questions.question: Anyone ………………………. do this. (Ability)
questions.description: We use can to express ability.

questions.question: I ……………………….. have married her if I had wanted to. (Unrealized past ability)
questions.description: Could have + past participle can be used to talk about past events that did not happen.

questions.question: We ………………………. go swimming on the weekend. (Possibility)
questions.description: May is used to indicate possibility.

questions.question: I was so angry I ………………………… have slapped him.
questions.description: Could have + past participle can be used to talk about past events that did not happen.

questions.question: One day, it ………………………. be possible to live on other planets. (Future prediction)
questions.description: We use will to simply predict future.

questions.question: Tropical areas ………………………… be very warm throughout the year. (Possibility)
questions.description: We use can to talk about theoretical possibility.

questions.question: Epidemics ……………………….. break out any day. (Theoretical possibility)
questions.description: We use can to talk about theoretical possibility.

questions.question: ‘Where is Janet?’ ‘She ………………………… be in the basement.’
questions.description: Can is not used to talk about logical possibility in affirmative sentences.

questions.question: ‘What ………………………….. we do now?’
questions.description: Shall is used to ask for suggestions.
